org.epochx.tools.grammar
Class NonTerminalSymbol

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.tools.grammar.NonTerminalSymbol
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Symbol
public class NonTerminalSymbol
extends java.lang.Object
implements Symbol

A non-terminal node of a parse tree, that was constructed to satisfy a specific rule of a grammar. The underlying GrammarRule is provided at construction time. An instance's children are those Symbol objects that the non-terminal resolves to, as supported by the grammar rule.

See Also:
TerminalSymbol, GrammarRule

Parameters:
grammarRule - the GrammarRule which this new object is representing an instance of
children - a list of Symbol instances which this NonTerminalSymbol resolves to, as supported by the grammar rule.

getChildren

public java.util.List<Symbol> getChildren()
Returns a reference to the underlying List of child Symbol instances for this non-terminal. Any changes to the returned list will be reflected in this symbol.

Returns:
a List of the child Symbol instances.

setChildren

public void setChildren(java.util.List<Symbol> newChildren)
Overwrites this non-terminal's List of child Symbols.

Parameters:
newChildren - the List of child Symbol instances to set.

getNoNonTerminalSymbols

public int getNoNonTerminalSymbols()
Calculates and returns the number of non-terminal symbols that exist within the tree rooted at this non-terminal symbol, including this Symbol. The result should always be equal or greater than 1.

Returns:
a positive integer which is the count of the number of NonTerminalSymbol instances in the parse tree rooted at this Symbol, inclusive of this symbol.

getNoNonTerminalSymbols

public int getNoNonTerminalSymbols(GrammarRule rule)
Calculates and returns the number of non-terminal symbols that exist within the tree rooted at this non-terminal symbol which have the specified underlying GrammarRule. The count is inclusive of this NonTerminalSymbol. A NonTerminalSymbol xis included in the count if the following expression is true.
this.getGrammarRule().equals(x.getGrammarRule())

Parameters:
rule - the GrammarRule that should be matched in all NonTerminalSymbols included in the count.
Returns:
the total number of non-terminal symbols that have a matching GrammarRule.

getNoTerminalSymbols

public int getNoTerminalSymbols()
Calculates and returns the number of terminal symbols that exist at the leaves of the parse tree rooted at this non-terminal symbol. The count should always be positive, and will only ever be zero in the case of an incomplete parse tree.

Returns:
an int which is the total number of terminal symbols in this parse tree.

getNoSymbols

public int getNoSymbols()
Calculates and returns the total number of Symbol instances that exist in the parse tree rooted at this non-terminal symbol, including this Symbol itself. The result should be equal to the sum of the results from the getNoNonTerminalSymbols() and getNoTerminalSymbols() methods.

Returns:
the total number of symbols that exist in the parse tree rooted at this Symbol.

getNoChildren

public int getNoChildren()
Returns the number of direct child Symbols this non-terminal symbol has.

Returns:
an int which is the number of child symbols this non-terminal has.

removeNthNonTerminal

public NonTerminalSymbol removeNthNonTerminal(int n)
Removes the nth non-terminal from the parse tree rooted at this NonTerminalSymbol instance, as counted using a pre-order traversal. Indexing starts at zero for this non-terminal symbol. As such, valid values of n must be greater than or equal to 1, since it is impossible to remove a symbol from itself.

Parameters:
n - an int with a value of 1 or greater which is the index of the NonTerminalSymbol that should be removed.
Returns:
the NonTerminalSymbol that was removed, or null if none were removed.

removeNthNonTerminal

public NonTerminalSymbol removeNthNonTerminal(int n,
                                              GrammarRule grammarRule)
Removes the nth non-terminal with the given GrammarRule from the parse tree rooted at this NonTerminalSymbol instance, as counted using a pre-order traversal. Indexing starts at zero and from this non-terminal symbol itself. It does not make sense to remove this Symbol from itself however so a value for n of 0 is only possible if the given GrammarRule does not match this Symbol.

Parameters:
n - an int which is the index of the NonTerminalSymbol with the given grammar rule that should be removed.
grammarRule - the GrammarRule that the symbol to be removed should have.
Returns:
the NonTerminalSymbol that was removed, or null if none were removed.

getNthNonTerminal

public NonTerminalSymbol getNthNonTerminal(int n)
Returns the nth non-terminal from the parse tree rooted at this NonTerminalSymbol. Indexing starts at zero for this symbol as the root, and proceeds in a pre-order traversal of the tree.

Parameters:
n - the index of the non-terminal to return.
Returns:
the NonTerminalSymbol which was the nth in the parse tree.

getNthSymbol

public Symbol getNthSymbol(int n)
Returns the nth symbol from the parse tree rooted at this symbol. Indexing starts at zero for this, the root, and proceeds in a pre-order traversal of the tree until the nth symbol is found.

Parameters:
n - the index of the symbol to be returned.
Returns:
the nth symbol from this parse tree.

setNthSymbol

public void setNthSymbol(int n,
                         Symbol newSymbol)
Overwrites the nth symbol in the parse tree rooted at this symbol. Indexing starts at zero for this, the root and proceeds in a pre-order traversal of the tree until the nth symbol is found. However, it is not possible to set the zeroth symbol since that would mean replacing this instance itself. To replace it, the setNthSymbol method should be called upon any parent NonTerminalSymbol or if it is the root of the whole tree then by using the replacement directly as the new parse tree.

Parameters:
n - the index of where to set the new symbol.
newSymbol - the replacement Symbol to set at the nth position.

getNonTerminalSymbols

public java.util.List<NonTerminalSymbol> getNonTerminalSymbols()
Returns a List of all the non-terminal symbols in the parse tree below this symbol, including this symbol itself.

Returns:
a List of NonTerminalSymbol instances from the parse tree rooted at this symbol.

getNonTerminalIndexes

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getNonTerminalIndexes()
Returns a List of the indexes of all the symbols in the parse tree rooted at this symbol that are instances of NonTerminalSymbol.

Returns:
a List of Integers which are the indexes of the non-terminal symbols in the parse tree rooted at this symbol.

getTerminalSymbols

public java.util.List<TerminalSymbol> getTerminalSymbols()
Returns a List of all the terminal symbols in the parse tree below this non-terminal symbol.

Returns:
a List of TerminalSymbol instances from the parse tree rooted at this symbol.

getAllSymbols

public java.util.List<Symbol> getAllSymbols()
Returns a List of all Symbol instances from the parse tree rooted at this symbol.

Returns:
a List of Symbol instances from the parse tree rooted at this symbol.

getGrammarRule

public GrammarRule getGrammarRule()
Returns this non-terminal symbol's grammar rule.

Returns:
the underlying grammar rule this non-terminal symbol is defined by.

getDepth

public int getDepth()
Returns the depth of the parse tree rooted at this NonTerminalSymbol. The depth is considered to be the maximum number of steps down the tree from this symbol to a terminal symbol. A tree made up of one non-terminal symbol with all terminal children will have a depth of 1.

Returns:
the depth of the parse tree rooted at this symbol.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this non-terminal symbol, which is a conjunction of the string representations of each child symbol.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a String representation of this object.

clone

public NonTerminalSymbol clone()
Constructs and returns a copy of this non-terminal symbol. Each child Symbol is itself cloned, but the grammar rule is shallow copied.

Specified by:
clone in interface Symbol
Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a copy of this non-terminal symbol.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Tests the given Object for equality with this non-terminal symbol. They will be considered equal if the given Object is an instance of NonTerminalSymbol, all their child symbols are equal according to the contract of their equals method, in the same order, and their grammar rules refer to the same instance.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
obj - the Object to test for equality.
Returns:
true if the given Object is equal to this non-terminal according to the contract outlined above and false otherwise.
